org.java_lcw

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.java_lcw.Image

  • public class Image
extends java.lang.Object
    Main Image object used to construct new Image files.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Image.Color
      This class is how colors are passed around to/from the Image Object
      static class  Image.ImageException 
      static class  Image.ImageType
      Image Types for Image Object to use (open/save)
      static class  Image.ScaleType
      ScaleTypes that can be used when resizing an Image.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte MODE_L
      MODE_L is grey scaled image (8 bits per pixel, 1 channel)
      static byte MODE_RGB
      MODE_RGB is an RGB (Red Green Blue) image Each color is its own Channel (24 bits per pixel, 3 channels)
      static byte MODE_RGBA
      MODE_RGBA is an RGBA (Red Green Blue Alpha) image Each color and alpha has its own Channel (32 bits per pixel, 4 channels)

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Image create(byte mode,
           int width,
           int height)
        Main Method for creating a new Image
        Parameters:
        mode - Image mode, uses the static bytes Image.MODE_(L, RGB, RGBA)
        width - How wide the image should be in pixels
        height - How high the Image should be in pixels
        Returns:
        Returns an Image object

      • fromByteArray

        public static Image fromByteArray(byte mode,
                  int width,
                  int height,
                  byte[] data)
                           throws Image.ImageException
        Create an Image object from a byte Array. The byte array must be a single array of bytes representing the mode given (L, RGB, or RGBA)
        Parameters:
        mode - Image mode, uses the static bytes Image.MODE_(L, RGB, RGBA)
        width - How wide the image should be in pixels
        height - How high the Image should be in pixels
        data - byte[] to use to loading the data
        Returns:
        Returns an Image object with the provided byte[] set in it
        Throws:
        Image.ImageException - This happens if the data provided is to large or to small for the (mode/8)*width*height

      • open

        public static Image open(java.lang.String filename)
                  throws Image.ImageException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Static Method that allows you to open a file, just pass in the path/filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - Filename to attempt to open.
        Returns:
        Returns an Image object from the provided file.
        Throws:
        Image.ImageException - This can happen if we do not know the type of file we where asked to open.
        java.io.IOException - This happens when we can not access the file.

      • open

        public static Image open(java.lang.String filename,
         Image.ImageType type)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         Image.ImageException
        Static Method that allows you to open a file, just pass in the path/filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - Filename to attempt to open.
        type - Type of file to open used Image.ImageType.(TIFF, PNG, JPEG)
        Returns:
        Returns an Image object from the provided file.
        Throws:
        Image.ImageException - This can happen if we do not know the type of file we where asked to open.
        java.io.IOException - This happens when we can not access the file.

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 Image.ImageException
        Save the image to the given file name. We determine the type based on the file extension (required)
        Parameters:
        filename - Path/Name of the file to save
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This happens if we can not save/open that file
        Image.ImageException - This happens if we can not figure out the type you want use to save as

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String filename,
        Image.ImageType type)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 Image.ImageException
        Save the image to the given file name. We determine the type based on the file extension (required)
        Parameters:
        filename - Path/Name of the file to save
        type - Type of file to open used Image.ImageType.(TIFF, PNG, JPEG)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This happens if we can not save/open that file
        Image.ImageException - This happens if we can not figure out the type you want use to save as

      • fromBufferedImage

        public static Image fromBufferedImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage BI)
                               throws Image.ImageException
        Create an Image from a BufferedImage from AWT - The new Image will always be RGBA type
        Parameters:
        BI - BufferedImage to use to make the Image object
        Returns:
        returns an Image object based from the BufferedImage
        Throws:
        Image.ImageException - This happens if there is something wrong with the BufferedImage

      • toBufferedImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage toBufferedImage()
                                             throws Image.ImageException
        Take the current Image object and make a BufferedImage out of it. This is always of TYPE_INT_ARGB.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage
        Throws:
        Image.ImageException

      • fromImageData

        public static Image fromImageData(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageData data)
                           throws Image.ImageException
        This takes ImageData from SWT and makes an Image Object.
        Parameters:
        data - ImageData object to create an Image object from.
        Returns:
        An Image Object based from the ImageData provided.
        Throws:
        Image.ImageException

      • toImageData

        public org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageData toImageData()
        Create an SWT ImageData object based from the current Image object
        Returns:
        ImageData object

      • changeMode

        public Image changeMode(byte MODE)
                 throws Image.ImageException
        Change the MODE of the current Image. Use the static MODE_ types MODE_RGBA = 4 byte Image with an alpha channel MODE_RGB = 3 byte image MODE_L = 1 byte Image (black and white)
        Parameters:
        MODE - Sets the Image.MODE_ to change to
        Returns:
        Returns a new Image Object in that mode (Caution current Image object should be discarded as changes to it could effect the new Image Object
        Throws:
        Image.ImageException

      • resize

        public Image resize(int width,
           int height)
        This resizes the Image, uses the Nearest Neighbor scaler, and keeps aspect ratio
        Parameters:
        width - new Width
        height - new Height
        Returns:
        new Image object of the given size

      • resize

        public Image resize(int width,
           int height,
           boolean keepAspect)
        This resizes the Image, uses the Nearest Neighbor scaler, and keeps aspect ratio
        Parameters:
        width - new Width
        height - new Height
        keepAspect - boolean, true means keep aspect, false means dont keep the aspect
        Returns:
        new Image object of the given size

      • resize

        public Image resize(int width,
           int height,
           boolean keepAspect,
           Image.ScaleType st)
        This resizes the Image
        Parameters:
        width - new Width
        height - new Height
        keepAspect - boolean, true means keep aspect, false means dont keep the aspect
        st - ScaleType to use (see Image.ScaleTypes)
        Returns:
        new Image object of the given size

      • setPixel

            int y,
            Image.Color c)
        Set a pixel in this image to a given Color
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the pixel
        y - Y position of the pixel
        c - Color to set the pixel to (see Image.Color)

                   int y)

        Parameters:

        y - Y position of the pixel
        Returns:

      • merge

        public void merge(int x,
         int y,
         Image img)
           throws Image.ImageException
        Merges the given Image object onto the Image If the given Image is taller or wider then this Image we only merge the visable bits onto this Image
        Parameters:
        x - X position to start the merge
        y - Y position to start the merge
        img - Image object to merge
        Throws:
        Image.ImageException

      • toArray

        public byte[] toArray()
        Outputs this image to a ByteArray. This has to be constructed so should not be called unless it is needed
        Returns:
        byte[] of the raw Image data

      • getBPP

        public byte getBPP()
        Get the number of bitsPerPixel, this is the same as the Image.MODE_ of the Image
        Returns:
        byte (8, 24, 32)

      • getChannels

        public byte getChannels()
        Returns the number channels in this Image (BPP/8)
        Returns:
        byte (1, 3, or 4)
